Message.Explanation: The specified entry in the configuration file does not exist as expected. This configuration file is not valid.
Message.UserResponse: Either restore a valid backup from a previous configuration, or use the Application Server administrative interfaces to fix the settings in the file.

Message.MsgText: advise.copy.files.nooverwrite=MIGR0451W: Migration copied file originally located at {0} to local path {1}
Message.Explanation: Migration copied the file because it had not already been processed during migration.
Message.UserResponse: No user action is required.

Message.MsgText: advise.migrate.washome.properties=MIGR0545I: The WebSphere Application Server installation configuration file {0} was migrated successfully. However, the changes should be reviewed and updated if necessary.
Message.Explanation: The specified WebSphere Application Server installation configuration file might contain settings which are incompatible with the new installation.
Message.UserResponse: Verify and manually modify the settings in the specified file as needed.

Message.MsgText: advise.logging.completed.with.warnings=MIGR0271W: Migration completed successfully, with one or more warnings.
Message.Explanation: The migration completed with some warning messages, but no errors occurred.
Message.UserResponse: For further information; check the log file that was created by the migration command in the logs directory, and correct the problems if required. The log name includes a time stamp, so check the log file with the latest creation date.

Message.MsgText: ignore.oldprofile.parameter=MIGR0487I: The {0} parameter not required in this scenario, and is being ignored.
Message.Explanation: The identified parameter is not needed for the current migration.
Message.UserResponse: No action is neccessary.

Message.MsgText: advise.deployment.manager.conflict.nodisable=MIGR0456W: Do not use the existing deployment manager in the old configuration.
Message.Explanation: The migration of a deployment manager to the latest release is successful. This migration creates the same port definitions as those on the existing Application Server configuration. Stop the deployment manager of the existing configuration before starting the deployment manager in the new configuration. Use the deployment manager of the new configuration to manage the environment.
Message.UserResponse: If you want to use the old environment, restart the prior version Deployment Manager.

Message.MsgText: microsoft.property.modified3=MIGR0517W: The following properties: {0} were used to determine the {1} setting for the Microsoft SQL Server JDBC Driver requirements. Validate changes made.
Message.Explanation: A set of properties were used to determine the final setting for a Microsoft data source property. These changes should be validated for correctness on your system.
Message.UserResponse: See information center for further details.

Message.MsgText: microsoft.property.modified2=MIGR0516W: Property {0} has been mapped to conform to Microsoft SQL Server JDBC Driver requirements. Validate changes made to {1}.
Message.Explanation: Property has been converted to conform to Microsoft data source requirements. These changes should be validated for correctness on your system.
Message.UserResponse: See information center for further details.

Message.MsgText: advise.need.newadminagent.info=MIGR0511E: Admin Agent information for the new release is invalid
Message.Explanation: The admin agent profile path for the new release is invalid
Message.UserResponse: Make sure that the admin agent information for the new release is valid

Message.MsgText: machine.change.hostname.check.identical=MIGR0513W: A cross machine migration detected. However, the source and target hostnames are identical - hostname={0} You will need to validate the host name setting of your endpoints.
Message.Explanation: The WASPostUpgrade detected that the WASPreUpgrade command used the -machineChange true parameter. This usually indicates a hostname change. WASPostUpgrade detected that the new and the old host names are identical.
Message.UserResponse: After migration, you will need to validate that the each endpoint has the correct host name assigned.

Message.MsgText: advise.bad.command=MIGR0530E: Unable to run command {0}
Message.Explanation: The command cannot be run
Message.UserResponse: Make sure the command is correct. Run the WASPostUpgradeBLAHelper script after fixing the problem.

Message.MsgText: advise.deployment.manager.conflict=MIGR0379W: Do not use the existing deployment manager in the old configuration. It has been disabled.
Message.Explanation: The migration of a deployment manager to the latest release is successful. This migration creates the same port definitions as those on the existing Application Server configuration. Stop the deployment manager of the existing configuration before starting the deployment manager in the new configuration, and do not use it. Use the deployment manager of the new configuration to manage the environment.
Message.UserResponse: If you want to roll back to use the previous Application Server Version 5.1, 6.0 or 6.1 environment instead of Version 7.0, you must re-enable that configuration. To do this, go to the /bin directory of the previous Version 5.1 6.0 or 6.1 installation and run the migrationDisablementReversal.jacl script.

Message.MsgText: advise.setupCmdLine.file.not.valid=MIGR0114E: The migration function cannot find the setupCmdLine setting {0}.
Message.Explanation: The migration function cannot find a specific property in an IBM-supplied file.
Message.UserResponse: See the problem determination information on the Application Server Support Web page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/

Message.MsgText: advise.synchronize.attempt=MIGR0351I: The migration function is attempting to synchronize with the deployment manager using the {0} protocol.
Message.Explanation: The function is trying to connect to the deployment manager using the specified protocol.
Message.UserResponse: No user action is required.

Message.MsgText: advise.incorrect.repository.connection=MIGR0428E: Incorrect Deployment Manager connection established.
Message.Explanation: The deployment manager to which this node belongs is not the deployment manager currently running.
Message.UserResponse: Shut down the incorrect deployment manager, and start the deployment manager that is currently managing the node to be migrated.

Message.MsgText: advise.backup.directory.notwriteable=MIGR0112E: The specified backup directory cannot be used because it is not writable.
Message.Explanation: Specify a writable directory so that files containing the configuration information for the current release can be saved.
Message.UserResponse: Run the command again and specify the name of a writeable directory.

Message.MsgText: preupgrade.supported=MIGR0462I: Application Server factor is saving base configuration files.
Message.Explanation: This indicates that a backup of the existing configuration is being saved for use during the WASPostUpgrade step of migration.
Message.UserResponse: No user action is required.

Message.MsgText: advise.bad.jythonfile=MIGR0531E: Unable to run jython file {0}
Message.Explanation: The jython file cannot be run
Message.UserResponse: Make sure the jython file and its contents are correct. Run the WASPostUpgradeBLAHelper script after fixing the problem.

Message.MsgText: advise.logging.adding.element=MIGR0223I: The migration function is adding {0} entry {1} to the model.
Message.Explanation: The specified object is being added to the configuration of the new Application Server version.
Message.UserResponse: No user action is required.

Message.MsgText: advise.cmd.line.illegal=MIGR0106E: The illegal argument {0} is specified.
Message.Explanation: The specified parameter is not supported by the command.
Message.UserResponse: Check the spelling of the parameter and run the command again.

Message.MsgText: advise.library.not.copied=MIGR0574W: The following library was not copied: {0}.
Message.Explanation: The library was not copied to the new location because of insufficient disk space, file handles, system memory, or permissions, or other system causes.
Message.UserResponse: You must manually migrate the library to its new location and update the library path. You can edit the library path in the administrative console or by using wsadmin scripting. For more information, see the documentation about managing a shared library and configuring a shared library using scripting.

Message.MsgText: advise.commands.notsaved=MIGR0533E: Commands not saved {0}
Message.Explanation: The commands could not be saved
Message.UserResponse: Check the logs to see why the commands could not be saved. Run the WASPostUpgradeBLAHelper script after fixing the problem.

Message.MsgText: client.usage.message9=MIGR0905W: An unacceptable parameter was specified {0}.
Message.Explanation: A specified parameter is not recognized as a valid parameter.
Message.UserResponse: Verify spelling and run the command alone, without any parameters or arguments, to get the correct syntax of the command.

Message.MsgText: advise.copy.files.general=MIGR0450W: Some files were copied directly without being processed by migration, review MIGR0451W messages in the log file.
Message.Explanation: The Application Server migration tooling did not process some files that were saved during WASPreUpgrade. This is part of tooling to support migration from one machine to another and is an expected message when migrating to a different machine
Message.UserResponse: Review the log from migration WASPostUpgrade, and check for MIGR0451W messages in the log file.

Message.MsgText: client.usage.message8=MIGR0904W: The enterprise archive (EAR) file {0} is not valid.
Message.Explanation: The enterprise archive (EAR) file name is either not an EAR file, or the contents and structure of the EAR file do not conform to a supported Java Platform Enterprise Edition, Java EE, specification.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that the path is spelled correctly and that a valid EAR file is in that location.

Message.MsgText: client.usage.message7=MIGR0903W: A value for attribute {0} is missing.
Message.Explanation: No argument is provided for the specified attribute. For example, the parameter '-traceFile' was used, but '-traceFile /some/path/to/log/file.txt' was required.
Message.UserResponse: Supply an argument for the specified parameter.

Message.MsgText: client.usage.message5=MIGR0901W: You must use the -traceString parameter with the -traceFile parameter.
Message.Explanation: When you specify a file trace, you must also specify the level of detail to write out to trace through the -traceString parameter.
Message.UserResponse: Add the -traceString parameter. For example: -traceString "*=all=enabled" You must include the quotation marks.

Message.MsgText: usage.post.line1=MIGR0002I: The class name of the WASPostUpgrade command is WASPostUpgrade
Message.Explanation: None
Message.UserResponse: No user action is required.

Message.MsgText: advise.logging.read.success=MIGR0237I: The migration function read configuration file {0} successfully.
Message.Explanation: The configuration file was successfully read.
Message.UserResponse: No user action is required.

Message.MsgText: advise.logging.completed.with.errors=MIGR0286E: The migration failed to complete.
Message.Explanation: The migration failed to complete because errors occurred during migration.
Message.UserResponse: For additional information; check the log file that was created by the migration command in the logs directory, and correct the problems if required. The log name includes a time stamp, so check the log file with the latest creation date.

Message.MsgText: advise.logging.object.locate=MIGR0234W: The migration function cannot locate object {0} of type {1}.
Message.Explanation: The migration function cannot locate the object of the specified type when attempting to migrate it.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that the object exists in the backup environment that results from the WASPreUpgrade command. If the problem persists, see the problem determination information on the Application Server Support Web page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/.

Message.MsgText: advise.registering.with.new.adminagent=MIGR0509I: Registering with new admin agent, make sure new admin agent process is running
Message.Explanation: Since this is a managed application server, migration will try to register the application server to the new admin agent after migration of the appserver completes successfully.
Message.UserResponse: Make sure that the new admin agent is running

Message.MsgText: advise.logging.not.migrating.admin.app=MIGR0346I: Object {0} of type {1} is not migrating; it is an administrative application.
Message.Explanation: No administrative applications are migrated during the WASPostUpgrade process.
Message.UserResponse: No user action is required.

Message.MsgText: advise.invalid.WAS.combination=MIGR0345E: The migration backup directory is not compatible with this Application Server version.
Message.Explanation: The migration function cannot apply the version of Application Server that is designated as a backup in the specified directory. Either the version in the backup directory is not supported, or the WebSphere products are not compatible.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that the combination of WebSphere product types is in the backup directory and that the current versions are compatible.

Message.MsgText: advise.logging.waspreupgrade.completed.successfully=MIGR0420I: The first step of migration completed successfully.
Message.Explanation: The migration completed with no warning or error messages.
Message.UserResponse: No user action is required.

Message.MsgText: advise.unable.to.run.retrieveSigners=MIGR0520E: The migration function cannot exchange the signer certificates. Run the retrieveSigners command to exchange the certificates manually.
Message.Explanation: During migration processing, the retrieveSigners command was attempted, but did not complete.
Message.UserResponse: Manually run the retrieveSigners command. After the command completes successfully, re-run the WASPostUpgrade command if it did not complete.

Message.MsgText: advise.cell.not.match=MIGR0415E: The cell name {0} from the old configuration does not match the cell name {1} in the target profile. No migration can occur.
Message.Explanation: While processing a deployment manager configuration the cell names of the old and new configurations did not match. This is not a supported migration path.
Message.UserResponse: Perform migration again using a profile name with the matching cell name.

Message.MsgText: advise.logging.unable.to.create.directory.file=MIGR0212E: The migration function cannot create the directory {0}. A file with this name already exists.
Message.Explanation: An unexpected failure occurred during the creation of a directory.
Message.UserResponse: Delete or rename the directory, and rerun the function using either the WASPreUpgrade or the WASPostUpgrade command.

Message.MsgText: advise.logging.includeapps.false=MIGR0389I: Applications will not be migrated, the -includeApps attribute was set to false.
Message.Explanation: When the -includeApps attribute is set to false, no user applications are installed on the new version.
Message.UserResponse: Install the application using the Application Server administration interfaces.

Message.MsgText: advise.not.migrating.zos.variable=MIGR0521W: Not migrating variable {0} for zOS. The default value will be used in the target profile.
Message.Explanation: The default value is recommended.
Message.UserResponse: If a value other than the default is needed, the value can be updated after the migration.

Message.MsgText: advise.security.credentials.required.commandline=MIGR0458E: Security is enabled in your prior configuration. -username and -password are required arguments.
Message.Explanation: WASPostUpgrade requires the user name and password to perform administrative functions against the prior configuration.
Message.UserResponse: Rerun WASPostUpgrade and supply the user name and password of your prior configuration.

Message.MsgText: advise.commands.saved=MIGR0532I: The commands have been saved
Message.Explanation: The wsadmin commands have been saved
Message.UserResponse: No further action needed to install BLAs

Message.MsgText: advise.logging.XMLConfig.readFile=MIGR0221I: The migration function is reading the previously saved configuration file {0}.
Message.Explanation: The specified configuration file from a previous Application Server version is being read. This file is the source for importing objects into the new Application Server configuration.
Message.UserResponse: No user action is required.

Message.MsgText: advise.need.adminagent.info=MIGR0505E: Need adminagent information from old and new versions
Message.Explanation: While migrating an appserver that is managed by an admin agent, the path, soap port, username and password of both the old and new admin agents are required.
Message.UserResponse: Run the postupgrade command by passing in parameters for the old and new admin agents

Message.MsgText: advise.library.migration.blocked=MIGR0575W: The following library was not migrated to avoid corrupting the new application server installation or target profile: {0}.
Message.Explanation: Migrating the directory defined in the library path will corrupt the new installation or profile.
Message.UserResponse: You must manually migrate the library to its new location and update the library path to refer to a file or set of files instead of the directory. You can edit the library path in the administrative console or by using wsadmin scripting. For more information, see the documentation about managing a shared library and configuring a shared library using scripting.

Message.MsgText: advise.unable.to.deploy.app=MIGR0340W: Application {0} did not deploy.
Message.Explanation: The call to the wsadmin command failed, and the specified application is not deployed.
Message.UserResponse: To determine why the call to the wsadmin command failed, check the <samp>wsadmin.traceout</samp> file in the logs directory of the installation root of the new version.

Message.MsgText: advise.adding.nodegroup.node=MIGR0417I: Node {0} is added to the default node group.
Message.Explanation: All nodes must belong to a node group. This node is added to the default node group.
Message.UserResponse: No user action is required.

Message.MsgText: advise.enterprise.businessprocesscontainer.disabled=MIGR0366W: The business process container is disabled because the required IBM WebSphere Business Integration Server Foundation feature is not installed.
Message.Explanation: The IBM WebSphere Business Integration Server Foundation process choreographer feature must be installed to use the container.
Message.UserResponse: Install the feature, and run the command again.

Message.MsgText: advise.nodeagent.conflict=MIGR0404W: Do not use the node agent in the old configuration. It has been disabled.
Message.Explanation: The migration of a deployment manager to the latest release is successful. This migration creates the same port definitions that are in the existing Application Server configuration. The node agent of the existing configuration must be stopped before starting the deployment manager in the new configuration. The deployment manager of the new configuration must be used to manage the environment.
Message.UserResponse: If you want to roll back to use the previous Application Server Version 5.1, 6.0 or 6.1 environment instead of Version 7.0, you must re-enable that configuration. To do this go to the /bin directory of the previous Version 5.1, 6.0 or 6.1 installation and run the migrationDisablementReversal.jacl script.

Message.MsgText: advise.unresolved.files=MIGR0452W: Migration could not locate a file matching {0} when migrating {1}. The reference has not been modified.
Message.Explanation: Migration found a reference to a file that could not be found as part of migration. This means the file was either not backed up during WASPreUpgrade or not copied forward during WASPostUpgrade.
Message.UserResponse: Copy the missing file to the location specified and rerun migration, or update the reference after migration has completed.

Message.MsgText: advise.jmsserver.to.jetstream.migration.failed=MIGR0397W: Service Integration Bus migration failed.
Message.Explanation: The migration of Embedded JMS to Service Integration Bus failed to migrate properly.
Message.UserResponse: See the information center for further action; if the answer is not found in the information center, contact IBM support.

Message.MsgText: advise.library.system.root.dir=MIGR0572W: The library was not migrated because the following library path refers to a system root directory: {0}.
Message.Explanation: Library paths that refer to a system root directory are not automatically migrated.
Message.UserResponse: If the library is at the defined path, you must manually migrate the library to its new location and update the library path. Otherwise, remove the library path. You can edit the library path in the administrative console or by using wsadmin scripting. For more information, see the documentation about managing a shared library and configuring a shared library using scripting.

Message.MsgText: sync.required=MIGR0477I: The Deployment Manager's configuration has been updated. A synchronization with the effected Managed nodes must occur before using these updated settings.
Message.Explanation: The Deployment Manager's configuration has been updated, but in order to have the settings consistent a synchronization must occur either automatically by the Deployment Manager or manually invoked.
Message.UserResponse: Synchronize the Deployment Manager's configuration with the effected Managed nodes.

Message.MsgText: advise.zos.invalid.direct.invocation=MIGR0426E: {0} command not supported on z/OS for direct invocation from the Unix shell. Use z/OS Migration Management Tool under WebSphere Customization Tools instead.
Message.Explanation: The direct invocation of WASPreUpgrade and WASPostUpgrade is not supported.
Message.UserResponse: Use z/OS Migration Management Tool under WebSphere Customization Tools to create your migration definitions.

Message.MsgText: advise.logging.updating.authmech=MIGR0332I: The attributes of the {0} authentication mechanism are updating.
Message.Explanation: The attributes of the specified authentication mechanism are being updated.
Message.UserResponse: No user action is required.

Message.MsgText: usage.earmigrate.failure=MIGR0327E: A failure occurred with {0}.
Message.Explanation: An unexpected error occurred.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that the user ID has sufficient file system authority to run the migration program. If the problem persists, see the problem determination information on the Application Server Support Web page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/.

Message.MsgText: host.value.missing.from.serverindex=MIGR0479E: The host value for the endpoint {0} in of the server {1} is invalid or missing.
Message.Explanation: Invalid host information exist for the specified entry. This information is required for migration processing.
Message.UserResponse: Correct the host information for the specified server in the serverindex in the master repository (which resides on the Deployment Manager in distributed configurations), and then rerun migration.

Message.MsgText: advise.invalid.config=MIGR0313E: More than one {0} directory exists; specify a directory using the {1} parameter.
Message.Explanation: More than one directory exists in the Application Server configuration.
Message.UserResponse: Rerun the command specifying the requested directory name by including the noted parameter.

Message.MsgText: advise.cmd.line.pre.requires.currentwasdirectory.and.backup=MIGR0482E: You must specify the <backupDirectoryName> and <currentWebSphereDirectory>.
Message.Explanation: WASPreUpgrade requires that the <backupDirectoryName> and <currentWebSphereDirectory> be specified.
Message.UserResponse: Run WASPreUpgrade again supplying the required parameters.

Message.MsgText: advise.brbeans.disabled=MIGR0280W: Application {0} is disabled because the required IBM WebSphere Business Integration Server Foundation feature is not installed.
Message.Explanation: The business rule beans that are featured in IBM WebSphere Business Integration Server Foundation must be installed to run business rule beans applications.
Message.UserResponse: Install the feature, and rerun the command.

Message.MsgText: advise.specific.application.failed.to.migrate=MIGR0496W: The migration of {0} terminated unexpectedly.
Message.Explanation: During the application migration process, one or more applications failed to migrate. Refer to the log files for details.
Message.UserResponse: If possible, correct the problems that are recorded in the log files. One or more applications might need to be installed manually.
